Authentic Ivorian Flavors and Good Vibes at YopCity ‚Äì Arthur Avenue, Bronx

I recently visited YopCity on Arthur Avenue in the Bronx with friends and family, and it was such a vibrant experience! As a fan of African cuisine, I was excited to try this Ivorian spot‚Äîand it did not disappoint.

I ordered the grilled fish topped with onions and peppers, paired with attieke (cassava couscous) and sweet plantains. The flavors were rich and satisfying, though I found the food a little on the oily side for my personal taste. Still, the seasoning and preparation were excellent.

One thing to note: my friend‚Äôs daughter has a peanut allergy, and when we asked if any dishes were made with peanut oil or peanut-based ingredients, the server wasn‚Äôt quite sure, so she played it safe and ordered French fries. It might be helpful if the staff were better informed about allergen information.

Two of the ladies in our group ordered the Dubi with sweet plantains and really enjoyed their meals. We also had bissap (hibiscus juice) and ginger juice, both of which were refreshing and delicious!

The music and atmosphere at YopCity were definitely a highlight‚Äîgreat energy, friendly vibe, and a space that made you want to dance. It‚Äôs a wonderful spot to enjoy a taste of West Africa right in the Bronx.

Overall, I‚Äôd recommend YopCity for anyone looking to explore Ivorian dishes and soak up good vibes. Just be sure to ask about ingredients if you have food allergies.

A Must-Try Spot for West African Food

If you‚Äôre looking for bold, authentic West African flavors in the Bronx, Yop City is where you need to be. I went in with high expectations and left completely blown away. The grilled lamb is out of this world‚Äîjuicy, tender, and packed with flavor. The onion-pepper relish that comes with it gives the dish just the right kick to balance the richness of the meat.

And if you‚Äôve never tried roast guinea fowl, this is the place to do it. Think of it as a mix between chicken and duck, but with a flavor that‚Äôs all its own. Every bite is better than the last. Don‚Äôt even get me started on the sides‚Äîalloco (fried sweet plantains) are crispy on the outside, soft on the inside, and downright addictive. Pair that with their super refreshing ginger drink, and you‚Äôre in for an unforgettable meal.

The vibe here is just as good as the food. The music, the friendly staff, the laid-back atmosphere‚Äîit all comes together to make you feel like you‚Äôve stepped into someone‚Äôs home for a meal. You‚Äôre not just eating; you‚Äôre part of the experience. Honestly, Yop City is one of those rare places where every dish is a hit and the service makes you want to come back again and again.

Trust me, you won‚Äôt regret checking this place out. It‚Äôs a hidden gem that deserves to be at the top of your list!

Impression: Yop City serves a small menu of lovingly prepared West African dishes in a sweet little restaurant nestled between so many Italian spots along Arthur Ave.  I wasn‚Äôt super hungry walking in, but I got the feeling from speaking with the owner that this is the kind of place that takes real pride in what they do so I wanted to try the food, hungry or not. I‚Äôm really glad I did.  The meal and the vibe were on the money.  We ordered the grilled lamb with white rice and the ginger drink.  It was a beautiful dish‚Ä¶ well seasoned and exceptionally tender chops (and an excellent portion) with an onion and pepper relish that added a good deal of heat and acid, perfectly balancing the richness of the meat and rice.  It was a hearty meal but we devoured it all.  This was an impressive dish and good enough to recommend the restaurant on its own.  The ginger drink was made with lots of fresh ginger and citrus, just a little sweet with a hell of a gingery kick.  They had African music playing that got us moving in our seats and laughing with the other customers (all west African but us) who couldn‚Äôt help but move to the music while they waited on their orders.  We left feeling full, happy, and like someone‚Äôs mother had cooked a meal just for us.

Recommendation: Make this a destination or check ‚Äòem out if you‚Äôre in the neighborhood.
